synopsis: In this engaging episode of Pineapple Blot Rotation, hosts Devam and Ahir, along with guest Garrett, delve into the complex relationship between body image and the gym. They share personal experiences, discuss societal pressures, and emphasize the importance of self-acceptance and enjoyment in fitness, all while maintaining a light-hearted and humorous tone.
quotes: The horror is persist, but so do we.
You can’t improve what you don’t acknowledge.
If you’re going to the gym to improve the way you look, you should also be going to the gym because it’s something you enjoy.
Your body will respond to stressors no matter when you put it through that.
Comparison is the thief of joy.
If you don’t have that passion or drive to go to the gym, find something active that you are passionate about.
Drink more water; it’s the simplest way to improve your mental and physical health.
If you’re going to value that glorified look over everything else, then you’re going to be depressed.
People are attracted to confidence and authenticity.
